website_summaries.verdict: This set makes the perfect toy for kiddos who love Disney’s Frozen and are yearning to use their imagination.
pros: Anna and Elsa figures look like the movie characters, which little fans will love
Includes ice castle and even a slide, a polar bear cub, and other fun accessories
Included bricks are compatible with other LEGO Junior sets
cons: Castle may be smaller than anticipated

customer_reviews.title: Great for older kids
customer_reviews.text: The pieces in this set are way too small for little kids. Constructing the set relies heavily on the manual (pictures only). The kids think it’s cool because it’s “Frozen”, but they did want to know why Olaf isn’t included in the set. Overall, I don’t think this set is developmentally appropriate for kids 4-7 years old. I prefer the chunky Duplos for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: cbp in georgia

customer_reviews.title: Great set for young kids, easy to put together and lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This set is so much fun for our 4 and 6 year old kids. It is easy enough that our 6 year old could put it together alone but the 4 year old needs help. The slide and the snow ball launcher are definitely the favorite features! This is a fun little set to add to our winter village. My only complaint is that I wish Olaf came with it. :/
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our kids love these!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves this set. She plays with it frequently and it keeps her attention. I had to put it together initially, but she has learned where the pieces go, so she moves them around and then puts them back. We got our son the batman/joker set and they play well together with them. Lego needs to expand the Juniors sets; they are just the right amount of pieces and intricacy for kids just getting into big kid Legos.
customer_reviews.author: LadyBuckeye

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Our Grandduaghter flipped when we gave it to her. Great introduction into fllowing instructions...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What a great buy. Our granddaughter flipped when we gave it to her! Easy to build. She went into her own zone and you could see her imagination come to life! It was a thrill. I had one question about the character's size... in answer, they are the exact same size as all the other Lego set characters we've purchased... including Star Wars Legos, Construction Legos, Military Legos, Etc. These are a great introduction into following instructions and diagrams and seeing fun results in the final assembly. Great learning tools.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cute LEGO set. My daughter wanted a Frozen birthday party, and this was a great gift. I even enjoyed putting it together with her lol. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jerrica

customer_reviews.title: easy to build, fun to play with
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a 4 year old as her first non-duplo set. She loved it. it was easy enough to build that with a little instruction, she could do it herself, and it's also small enough that she didn't lose interest. There were enough simple fun things to do with the set (treasure chest, little bear, slide) to keep her entertained with it. On the downside, it was slightly more expensive than I would have expected for a 100 piece set.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastien F

customer_reviews.title: So, this is pricey but it's retired so I get it.
customer_reviews.text: This product is selling here for a lot because they don't make this anymore. I wouldn't have bought it except it looked like the best frozen set and I knew my daughter would love it. As a Christmas gift for a 5 year old, it is great. She plays with it all the time and comes with many little cute features. Value for money? No, but we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria L.

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not “juniors”!
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute little set but way way too complicated to be a “juniors” set. It has very very small pieces (can’t even think what to compare them too- some as small or smaller than a pine nut.) my husband completed this with my child and I think it had almost 20 steps but almost each step had a, b, c. I wish there were truly legos juniors set comparable to duplos but to make designs like this.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta girl

customer_reviews.title: The slide makes it difficult for my young son to assemble but he loves it anyway
customer_reviews.text: My son loves Lego. I needed to switch up from minecraft and he has been listen to Frozen lately. Got it for a gift on his birthday in January and he still plays with it. He's five. When he forgets to put it back on the table and trips on it he does have trouble reassembling it more so than the same minecraft legos from the same age group. I think the slide throws him off.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: A 4 year old nor a 7 year old could possibly put this together!
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are little bitty! The picture is very hard to see, and the picture is ALL the directions you have! I just don’t believe an average 4 to 7 year old could put this together. The price is $79 for this toy. This toy is supposed to be enjoyable for the little kids . It frustrated me, and I’m the adult!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Richards

customer_reviews.title: Great little intro to legos for a little girl
customer_reviews.text: This was a favorite for a girl of five years-old with no experience with legos. She was so pleased we could create the house ourselves. She did require a lot of help. She then went on to play with it just as it was once complete.
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: Too tiny for Lil kids.
customer_reviews.text: This was so tiny, when she put it up, after her Pa put together, it fell apart
customer_reviews.author: Mickey's Friend

customer_reviews.title: Cute set.  More tiny pieces than I thought there would be
customer_reviews.text: It is a cute set but we were missing one of the tiny "goblets" . I bought this for my 2 y/o granddaughter who loves Elsa & Anna so she thought it was fun. Obviously we put it together for her and never let her have it alone. WAY too many tiny pieces1
customer_reviews.author: Didiwi

customer_reviews.title: Great Transition Set
customer_reviews.text: Great for a transition from DUPLOS to regular sized legos. My 3+ year old put this together with only a little help.
customer_reviews.author: Small Time Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful fir young and old .. Six yo grand daughter and 35 yo son play with A LOT , A LOT !!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME .. AWESOME .. AWESOME 👏 .. Grand daughter 6 yo and Dad can’t get enough of this Frozen Lego set !! They’re HUGE LEGO fans !! Spent many hours on already ... MANY !!!
customer_reviews.author: Tammie P.

customer_reviews.title: Frozen Legos
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved getting this for Christmas, then putting it together. Not too bad on small parts, she is 5 and still needed help putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: J Momma

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: Felt like there was little customizability. Felt more like work to assemble. Maybe i just wanted to inspire creativity with this. For the price i expected more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is terrrrrrible!!! The pieces are microscopic and there are waaaay too many!! Waste of money. No way a child could put this together!
customer_reviews.author: Becky K

customer_reviews.title: Good toy.
customer_reviews.text: I guess little girl loves the LEGO just because it’s “frozen”. I never seen little girl is playing lego. I think it’s a risk for me to pick this toy as a gift for little girl. So I guess I bought the right one.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I just received my lego junior frozen 2 set. I find it very hard to believe that this should be $75 when I’ve purchased similar sets for my daughter for $35-$40. Not only that, I’m sadly disappointed that it isn’t very well described. My daughter is 12 and can complete more complex LEGO sets in a day. This one is a joke. Who do I have to contact for me to return it quickly
customer_reviews.author: Megan Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: It will bring hours of joy
customer_reviews.text: It brought a big smile to my granddaughter's face she just loved the Lego. There are a lot of small parts so it's not for a child under the age of four or five.
customer_reviews.author: Lena Monitto

customer_reviews.title: Very small pieces
customer_reviews.text: This was not easy for Grandson to put together. The pieces are very small which made them hard to grip and put together. I think the age recommendation should be a little older.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Great Lego for younger kids!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 4y old niece. She loves Legos and Frozen, so this made for a perfect gift! I'm happy that Lego is making less complicated sets for younger kids these days!

customer_reviews.title: My 3 year old daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: Love this Elsa set. Best one I’ve bought yet. My only complaint is that elsas hair doesn’t stay on well but that’s not specific to this set, that’s all the LEGO elsa’s

customer_reviews.title: Cute Lego Set
customer_reviews.text: This was my 4-year-old's first Lego set. I had to help her build it, but she seems to enjoy it. She plays with it in the same way she'd play with her dolls and a dollhouse. Cute set.

product_meta.title: LEGO l Disney Frozen Anna & Elsa's Frozen Playground 10736 Disney Princess Toy
product_meta.description: Play in a magical winter playground with LEGO. Juniors Disney Frozen´s Anna and Elsa, featuring an Easy to Build ice palace with slide, bench and table, ramp for skiing, rotating fountain, snowball-firing catapult and an opening treasure chest with hidden ice crystals. LEGO Juniors is an age-appropriate build and play experience for ages 4-7. This LEGO l Disney Frozen set includes two mini-doll figures and a polar bear cub.
feature_bullets: Build your own Ice Castle, with two levels, a slide, treasure chest, snowball catapult and a rotating fountain!
Includes two mini-dolls, Anna and Elsa from Disney’s Frozen, plus polar bear cub figure
LEGO Juniors brick building toys are compatible with all other LEGO construction sets for creative building
Ice Castle measures over 7” high, 7” wide and 5” deep.
94 pieces – For boys and girls between the ages of 4 and 7 years old

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars621 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
